alert.note: Alert for Big Stone (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued May 30 at 3:34PM CDT until May 30 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN BIG STONE AND SOUTHEASTERN ROBERTS COUNTIES... At 334 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Lismore Colony, or 11 miles northwest of Big Stone City, moving north at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Barry, Big Stone Colony and Graceville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. If a tornado or other severe weather is spotted, report it to the National Weather Service or your local nearest law enforcement agency who will send your report. This act may save lives of others in the path of dangerous weather.
